title: Asteroid Deflection Succeeds
body: The KTX3 probe successfully executed a controlled kinetic impact on simulated target 2028-AL3. Trajectory alteration exceeded mission baseline by 9.7%. Onboard sensors recorded minimal fragmentation and validated autonomous vector correction systems under real-time latency.

title: 3I/ATLAS Trajectory Update
body: JPL released a revised course projection for interstellar object 3I/ATLAS. Spectral scans confirm metallic-rich surface composition and a tumbling rotation. Close solar pass expected to enhance data return via thermal resonance imaging—arrival window: 2029-Sep-03 ±12h.

title: Orbital Net Deployed
body: Low-orbit debris net 'Aegis-4' unfurled successfully above Mars' equatorial plane. Designed to capture micrometeoroids and mission remnants, the net uses nano-filament weave with magnetic repulsion nodes, providing a 38% increase in orbital safety for transit vessels.
